thig13.2:3.1: They don’t like to work, they’re lazy,
thig13.2:3.3: always on the lookout, greedy for sweets—
thig13.2:3.4: so why do you like ascetics?”
thig13.2:5.1: They like to work, they’re not lazy;
thig13.2:5.2: by giving up greed and hate,
thig13.2:5.3: they do the best kind of work—
thig13.2:6.1: As for the three roots of evil,
thig13.2:6.2: by pure deeds they shake them off.
thig13.2:6.3: They have given up all wickedness—
thig13.2:7.3: their actions of mind are pure—
thig13.2:9.1: They’re learned and memorize the teaching,
thig13.2:9.3: teaching the text and its meaning:
thig13.2:10.1: They’re learned and memorize the teaching,
thig13.2:11.3: they understand the end of suffering—
thig13.2:12.2: they don’t look back with longing,
thig13.2:13.1: They hoard no goods in storerooms,
thig13.2:13.3: They seek food prepared by others—
thig13.2:14.2: or gold whether coined or uncoined;
thig13.2:14.3: feeding on whatever comes that day,
thig13.2:15.1: They have gone forth from different families,
thig13.2:15.3: and yet they all love one another—
thig13.2:16.1: “Dear Rohinī, it was truly for our benefit
thig13.2:16.2: that you were born in our family!
thig13.2:16.3: You have faith and such keen respect
thig13.2:16.4: for the Buddha, his teaching, and the Sangha.
thig13.2:18.1: For there we will place our sacrifice,
thig13.2:19.1: go for refuge to the Buddha, the poised,
thig13.2:19.2: to his teaching and to the Sangha.
thig13.2:19.4: that will be good for you.”
thig13.2:20.1: “I go for refuge to the Buddha, the poised,
thig13.2:20.2: to his teaching and to the Sangha.
thig13.2:20.4: that will be good for me.
thig13.2:21.1: In the past I was related to Brahmā,
thig13.2:21.2: now I genuinely am a brahmin.
thig13.2:21.3: Possessing the three knowledges, I’m a genuine scholar,
thig13.2:21.4: I’m a knowledge-master, a bathed initiate.”
